Make samples compile with Java 1.5

(You can't @Override interface methods in
Java 1.5, but you can in 1.6. Android
Eclipse still uses Android 1.5 semantics.)

Repair Character encoding.

The translator accidentally converted the file's
character set to ISO-LATIN-1. Converted back to
UTF using:

iconv -f l1 -t utf-8 arrays.xml > temp && mv temp arrays.xml
iconv -f l1 -t utf-8 strings.xml > temp && mv temp strings.xml
First cut at 256-color support.

Remove logic for setting the color palette.

Mac terminal emulator doesn't implement it. (xterm does.)
Split text renderers into their own files.
Fix rotation of colored text.
Allow TERM to be set to xterm-256color

Implement plumbing for setting the terminal window title text.

(It's not hooked up to the actual UI yet.)

Updated Russian translation

Courtesy Сергей Богданов bogdanov.sergey.vyacheslavovich@gmail.com

Improve text style handling.

Underlined, bold, and invisible text now working.
Manage text foreground, background, and effect data as a single style int.
Treat inverse as a style.
Track cursor color and default text color as unique palette entries.
Handle the cursor color as part of the standard palette.

Fix color setting codes.

+ Add support for directly setting the 'bright' 8 system colors.
Make side-to-side flinging less sensitive.
Implement fling scrolling.

Poll for window size change unconditionally on API < 8

Automatic window resize appears to be broken on API < 8 when the status
bar is visible and the device is in landscape mode.

Strictly speaking, we could disable polling in portrait mode with the
status bar visible, but detecting orientation is a bit annoying and the
once-per-second polling has no effects other than wasting a little CPU
time in that case.  Instead, unconditionally poll for window size
changes on older platforms.

Store window title in TermSession and hook up display in UI

The window title is logically a property of the terminal session, so
store it as a field in the TermSession object, which allows us to just
do session.getTitle() (modulo minor complications) in TermViewFlipper
and WindowListAdapter when we want the session title.  (In practice, we
also add a getTitle() to ShellTermSession which takes a default title
argument to use in case of the title being null or empty, and use that
instead.)

We do still need a notification interface for when the title changes,
but we no longer need to pass around the title, so use the existing
UpdateCallback interface for that.  Also, extend SessionList to offer a
pass-through title change notification interface, which makes the
implementation in WindowListAdapter easier.

Fix terminal emulation bugs affecting window title setting

* doOSC() should call finishSequence()
* BEL (0x07) should not be ignored in process() while handling an ESC ]
sequence
* It's no longer always appropriate to call startEscapeSequence(ESC)
when handling a C1 control character -- call process((byte) 27)
instead, which will always produce the correct result

Use bright colors for bold text in one of the 8 traditional colors

In a traditional '16'-color terminal, the bold font also implies bright
colors, and programs depend on this behavior, particularly with regards
to 'bright black'.  Restore this behavior, which was lost when we
implemented 256-color support.
Don't draw spaces that are the same color as the background.

Merge pull request #135 from steven676/for-upstream

Window title setting and miscellaneous bugfixes
Remove unused variables.
Remove unused variables and methods.

Switch from xterm-256color to screen-256color

Steven Luo points out that we don't implement all the xterm escape
sequences, so a ncursor-based program will work better if it's told
that we are a screen-256color terminal rather than an xterm-256color
terminal.

Widget sample: fix build with NDK r8

NDK r8 ships more than one toolchain for all architectures; fix the
Makefile so that we don't try to use both at once.
Updated arrays.xml.

Remove TextStyle.fxFaint

We don't implement this style, very few other terminal emulators
implement it, very few applications depend on it, and dropping it allows
us to fit style information into 3 bytes.

Use a more compact representation for color information

By storing the formatting info in an array of byte[] with size 3x the
width of the transcript, we save one byte per character.

Memory footprint reduction for text style storage

Merge pull request #137 from gLes/master

Updated values-hu/arrays.xml

Fix crash when resizing transcript containing FullUnicodeLines

Commit 7135a50... ('Fix rotation of colored text.') introduced checking
of color and formatting attributes as well as text when determining the
last printing character on a line.  However, the naive approach to doing
this results in an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException when the text in
question contains non-BMP characters or combining characters, because in
those cases, the char array will be longer than the color array.

Fix this by using the correct index into the color array, the screen
column of the character.

Fix crash when resizing transcript containing non-BMP or combining characters
Add a simple test of combining characters and multi-plane characters.

TermService: unset FinishCallbacks before calling session.finish() in onDestroy()

Prevents a ConcurrentModificationException when there are multiple
sessions to finish in onDestroy().

Don't crash if mTermSessions == null while handling result from WindowListActivity

Not 100% sure how this happens in the first place, but this should at
least prevent the crash in #142.

Merge branch 'master' of github.com:jackpal/Android-Terminal-Emulator

Clean example and library output directories before building.

This seems to be needed when using git to switch back and forth between
different versions of the source tree. Otherwise we sometimes end up
with an API mis-match between the library and the appliation.

Move non-localizable stringarrays to separate file.

Now they will be easier to update, and less likely to be localized by
accident. (For example the ru translation had accidentally localized
the entryvalue_fontsize_preference entries.)
Deal with a couple more cases where mTermSessions could be null
TermSession: handle finishing a session before initialization gracefully

Guard against custom implementations of InputConnection

This should fix AbstractMethodError in EmulatorView$3.getSelectionStart(),
which has been occasionally seen in the Exception logs.

We extend a BaseInputConnection rather than implement an InputConnection
in order to avoid an AbstractMethodError in the case where we are running
on a custom ROM that has added a method to InputConnection. (We've seen
this occur a few timesin the exception logs.)

Using a BaseInputConnection rather than an InputConnection is a little bit
error prone because it means we won't get a compiler warning or error when
a new method has been added to InputConnection.
